results.title: The Wildlife of Macquarie Island
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Government Film Unit and Norman Laird
results.brief_description: A picture of the wildlife on Macquarie Island stressing the harshness of the environment, where one creature preys mercilessly on another. Seaweeds and lichens; elephant seals; cormorants, sea vultures and skuas; black-browed albatross and many species of penguin are seen in the struggle for existence. The savagery of birds of prey is demonstrated as vultures stand by at the birth of a baby seal.

results.title: The Wilderness world of Sigurd F. Olson
results.creator_credit: Filmedia, Ray J. Christensen and Steve A Kahlenbeck
results.brief_description: An exploration of the creative response to nature of America’s foremost interpretive naturalist, Sigurd F. Olson. He talks about the challenges and joys of writing, and the wilderness areas of Canada and the northern United States, with film of the dramatic changing seasons of this area.

results.title: The Wildcat
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Bert Haanstra
results.brief_description: Describes the techniques involving in well drilling - the erection of the derrick; the drilling at appropriate speeds through different formations; the hauling out and running in of formations; the hauling out and running in of the drill string; and the sealing and cementing of the various strings of casing. Work goes on night and day, involving at times great strain and tension. Finally, the flow tubing is run in, and gun perforation at the level of the producing formation allows oil to flow into the tubing and up the well.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shell Film Unit, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Bert Haanstra

results.title: The Wild Duck
results.creator_credit: Film Bancor of Aust, Phillip Emanuel and Henri Safran
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Henrik Ibsen about the fortunes of a loving family - the ineffectual loving father whose pride and dreams conceal a life of poverty and failure, his practical wife and their beautiful and faithful young daughter. The family is broken apart when deceived by the misplaced idealism of another person. Stars Liv Ullman and Jeremy Irons.

results.title: The Wiggles: yummy yummy
results.creator_credit: Wiggles Touring Pty Ltd, Nick Pike and Chisholm McTavish
results.brief_description: Greg, Murray, Anthony and Jeff sing 14 of your favourite songs; “Hot potato”, “D.O.R.O.T.H.Y”, “Pufferbillies”, “Henry’s dance”, “Walk”, “Joannie works with one hammer”, “The Monkey dance”, “Crunchy munchy honey cakes”, “Shaky shaky”, “Teddy bear hug”, “Havena shalom alachem”, “I am a dancer”, “Numbers rhumba” and “Fruit salad”. There are special appearances from Captain Feathersword, Henry the Octopus, Wags the Dog and Dorothy the Dinosaur.

results.title: The Wiggles: Yummmy yummy. Wiggle time
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Wiggles Touring Pty Ltd, Nick Pike and Chisholm McTavish
results.brief_description: Let the four coloured Wiggles entertain your pre-school child with simple songs that they can sing and dance along to. The Wiggles are presented here in a in a studio setting with simple sets and colourful costumes suitable for the very young. Jeff, Murray, Anthony and Greg are also joined by Wags the Dog, Henry, Dorothy the Dinosaur and Captain Feathersword. “Yummy Yummy” includes such songs as “Hot Potato”, “Walk”, and “Fruit Salad” with a total of fourteen to choose from. “Wiggle Time” songs include “Get Ready to Wiggle”, “Captain Feathersword” and “Rock-A-Bye Your Bear” amongst ten other titles.

results.title: The Wiggles: Wiggle Bay
results.creator_credit: Wiggles Touring Company, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Paul Field and Nicholas Bufalo
results.brief_description: Join the Wiggles and friends Wags the Dog, Henry the Octopus and Captain Feathersword as they head out on a special day at Wiggle Bay. Their plans appear to be ruined however when Captain Feathersword forgets to tie up the boat and it drifts out to sea - fortunately the Wiggles are able to amuse themselves with sand castles, fishing, spending time with Henry’s friend Magdalena the Mermaid, barbecuing, rolling down hills, and of course singing and dancing. All works out well and the Wiggles get a special shell call from King Neptune.

results.title: The Wiggles: Wake up Jeff!
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Wiggles Touring Company, Dean Covell and Keiran Usher
results.brief_description: Wake up Jeff! will have you jumping. Australia’s favourite children’s group “The Wiggles” are back singing and dancing in a brand new video. The Wiggles - Murray Cook, Jeff Fatt, Anthony Field and Greg Page, are joined by their friends Dorothy the Dinosaur, Henry the Octopus, Captain Feathersword and Wags his dog. Full of the songs and music that have made the Wiggles so well loved.

results.title: The Wiggles: The big red car
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), John Spence and Phillip Cullen
results.brief_description: The Wiggles are just about everyone’s favourite group and guaranteed to have you rocking in the loungeroom together with the children. Features 15 “wriggly” tracks including the title track “Big red car”. The Wiggles are joined by their special friends Dorothy the dinosaur, Henry the octopus, Captain Feathersword and introduces Wags the dog.

results.title: The Wiggles movie [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Gladusaurus Productions, Hilton Fatt and Dean Covell
results.brief_description: The Wiggles - Murray, Jeff, Anthony and Greg are planning a surprise birthday party for their friend Dorothy the Dinosaur. There is a big problem however, their guest of honor has gone missing, she’s in pursuit of a magician who has stolen Greg’s wand, and is upset to think her friends have forgotten her birthday. The Wiggles begin a pursuit of their own when they try to locate Dorothy in time for her party, having a wiggling good time along the way. This is The Wiggles first feature length film and includes seven new songs. Cast also includes Tony Harvey, Leeanne Ashley, Carolyn Ferrie, Paul Paddick, John Field and Joanne Samuel. Also available on VHS [310707]
